abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. It is important to
            reinforce emergency reconstruction operations should not be
            combined with broad sectoral policy reform efforts. This
            project is a good example of a well conceived post-conflict
            reconstruction operation. However, the project's
            experience supports the guidance provided in OP/BP 8.50 on
            emergency operations, by showing how difficult it is to
            implement urgently needed rehabilitation investments, while
            simultaneously pursuing broader policy reforms in a number
            of sectors. Sectoral objectives require support from more
            focused interventions. Addressing these kinds of objectives
            in sectors ranging from education and health to electricity
            and agriculture was outside the competency of ARRA -
            Azerbaijan Agency for Rehabilitation and Reconstruction of
            Areas - which had been established to implement the narrower
            reconstruction program. Further lessons suggest that
            operations involving multiple donors must be carefully
            designed to allow for different agendas, financing
            arrangements, and funding timetables among donors; yet, also
            suggest that too narrowly limiting project beneficiaries may
            create additional social and political risks.
